Articles.Content: Fuel line covers, I think. Oh, and if those dinky squares are grid fins, then they should be a lot bigger.
There were only four (big) grid fins from memory, and they were, well, fins.
Oww man, Ill love launching this when its ready...that is if you dont go full retard like I go with my conversions/mods and make them historical
Guys, this is not grid. I tried to do more details on the stage. Grid will be added later.

Oww man, Ill love launching this when its ready...that is if you dont go full retard like I go with my conversions/mods and make them historical

Oh, I know you. You have made R7, haven't you?
Yep...Im surprised tho...I expected no one cared about it...just please dont go offtopic, theres always PM

the N-1 is a Soviet Union launch vehicle. why wouldn't it be dependent?

someone didnt do their research...

It being a Soviet rocket has nothing to do with its dependancies on another mod pack.......someone didnt think before posting =P

Played around with this badboy a bit last night, I was able to put a 96ton fuel tank in place of the L3 payload and launch to LKO with very few issues...and most of those came from not enough torque.

Not only is this mod another great salute to the human drive for exploration, but its shaping up to be a really good heavy lift vehicle as well!!
Isnt that its RL payload? Ugh...should be a lot less me thinks...unless the author gave it RL size LoL! (but then it should be even more...Ill better stop typing)
Working on new boosters.
Whats that...Blok G? or is that one longer...? Or is that a new blok D? (as the real one aint accurate and should be about as wide as the proton, not the soyuz)

Whats that...Blok G? or is that one longer...? Or is that a new blok D? (as the real one aint accurate and should be about as wide as the proton, not the soyuz)

This is new Block G. I'm working on new Block D instead of Bobcat's

I don't think it's correct. Look here: http://www.russianspaceweb.com/n1_g.html You can see how the L3 complex looks at the time of Block G firing. It has a fairing covering it's tanks, and LK is covered, too. What you made looks more like Block D.

I don't think it's correct. Look here: http://www.russianspaceweb.com/n1_g.html You can see how the L3 complex looks at the time of Block G firing. It has a fairing covering it's tanks, and LK is covered, too. What you made looks more like Block D.

http://andegraf.com/rockets/n1.htm

I don't think it's correct. Look here: http://www.russianspaceweb.com/n1_g.html You can see how the L3 complex looks at the time of Block G firing. It has a fairing covering it's tanks, and LK is covered, too. What you made looks more like Block D.

Aaaaand what makes you think he wont slap 2 fairings on it?

Someone already linked here already, but this site has a lot information on the different variants of the N1.

The best N1 is the All-White N1-7L, which doesn't have that Flare-out at the bottom of the 1st stage.

Edited August 29, 2013 by finkmac

i use this picture. I think there are many var. of how this block looks like =\http://andegraf.com/rockets/n1.htm
Quite the contrary, the site shows everything. Just remember, there's the cross-section and there's actual exterior. Look at the pic labeled "7K-LOK". You can see Block G has a normal hull, with fairings attached on top of it. Also, take a look at Block D. It looks like BobCat wasn't that much off, until you realize this isn't a half-spherical tank, but a spherical tank encased in a shroud. N1 is a very complex and interesting rocket.

Hey guys...you should know..._I_ provided him with the andegraf page (which in turn, I have 1st posted on bobcats historical thread...page 40 and something)

Now, enough of bragging, yes that page is really really accurate, but only IF you can figure out what is what...

Or do you know what the last rocket on this page :

http://andegraf.com/rockets/proton.htm

is on top of your head?
Last one? It's a Proton with some weird solid add-ons. I haven't heard of this one, and it was probably a never flown concept. That said, it looks like it'd be a nice thing to have in KSP.
why would you have solids on a second stage tho? doubt thats feasible, rather stick 4 on the 1st stage.
